text: When I notice pressure to comply, I recognize it and choose to pause and think before responding.
During moments when someone wants me to obey quickly, I notice it and choose to slow down and decide instead.
When I feel the pull to follow authority without question, I notice it and choose to think independently instead.
I let not being able to resist obedience triggers prevent me from maintaining control over my decisions.
When I notice hooks like urgency or authority pressure, I recognize them and choose to resist instead.
I see when I'm being pressured to comply, and I choose to pause and make a conscious decision instead.
When I feel the urge to say yes to avoid tension, I notice it and choose to think about what I truly want instead.
I let not identifying obedience triggers prevent me from resisting pressure and maintaining autonomy.
When I notice myself resisting pressure, I recognize it and choose to maintain that independence.
I recognize when compliance comes from hooks rather than genuine choice, and I respond accordingly.
When I feel the pull to obey automatically, I notice it and choose to pause and decide consciously instead.
I let problems from not resisting triggers prevent me from maintaining control over my compliance decisions.
When I notice conscious decision-making working, I recognize it and choose to strengthen those patterns.
I see when I need to resist pressure, and I choose to pause and make an independent decision instead.
When I feel the urge to let social pressure control me, I notice it and choose to maintain autonomy instead.
I let not being able to identify triggers prevent me from resisting obedience and maintaining control.
When I notice myself making independent choices, I recognize it and choose to maintain that autonomy.
I recognize when compliance needs to be questioned, and I choose to pause and decide independently instead.
When I feel the pull to let authority override my judgment, I notice it and choose to think for myself instead.
I let not identifying obedience triggers prevent me from resisting pressure and maintaining control effectively.
